definitions.text: applying the mind to learning and understanding a subject (especially by reading)
examples: mastering a second language requires a lot of work
no schools offer graduate study in interior design

definitions.text: a written document describing the findings of some individual or group
examples: this accords with the recent study by Hill and Dale

definitions.text: a state of deep mental absorption
examples: she is in a deep study

definitions.text: a room used for reading and writing and studying
examples: he knocked lightly on the closed door of the study
in what discipline is his doctorate?
teachers should be well trained in their subject
anthropology is the study of human beings
he made several studies before starting to paint
after much cogitation he rejected the offer

definitions.text: someone who memorizes quickly and easily (as the lines for a part in a play)
examples: he is a quick study

definitions.text: a composition intended to develop one aspect of the performer's technique
examples: a study in spiccato bowing

definitions.text: consider in detail and subject to an analysis in order to discover essential features or meaning
examples: analyze a sonnet by Shakespeare
analyze the evidence in a criminal trial
analyze your real motives

definitions.text: be a student; follow a course of study; be enrolled at an institute of learning

examples: consider the possibility of moving

definitions.text: be a student of a certain subject
examples: She is reading for the bar exam
He is studying geology in his room
I have an exam next week; I must hit the books now

definitions.text: think intently and at length, as for spiritual purposes
examples: He is meditating in his study
